data.description:
SG Parl is an official app by the Parliament of Singapore. It is a one-stop information centre for you to find out more about your Member of Parliament and parliamentary proceedings.
 
The app contains, among others:
 (i) a database of the Members of Parliament listed alphabetically and by constituency, which also includes the venues and times for the weekly Meet-The-People Sessions,
(ii) an interactive seating plan of the Chamber,
(iii) items of business and order of business for upcoming parliament sittings,
(iv) various publications including Bills, Standing Orders and reports and
(v) a glossary of parliamentary terms.

Welcome to the BALIKSG: Reflections of Singapore app presented by the National Heritage Board (NHB) and the National Parks Board (NPARKS) to commemorate the Singapore Bicentennial. 
Have you ever imagined how Singapore was like when Sir Stamford Raffles landed or been intrigued by the history and legends of Fort Canning Hill? 
BALIKSG promises an immersive experience for users, with mixed reality graphics that will transport you to a reimagined past dating back to the 14th century.
Embark on The River and The Fort Trail to watch history come alive at 16 augmented reality (AR) Discovery Points. Step through a portal and witness the signing of the 6 February, 1819 treaty which established Singapore as a British trading post, one of the most important events in our history. Interact with the beloved bronze sculptures along the Singapore River and listen to Singapore’s early settlers describe their lives. Drop in on an archaeological dig to uncover secrets about Fort Canning Hill’s past.        

WHY GO ON THE BALIKSG TRAIL:
•	FREE: It’s completely free, and does not contain any in-app purchases. 
•	ACCESSIBLE: The trails are centrally located and conveniently accessible by public transportation.
•	HISTORICALLY ACCURATE: Storytelling is based on extensive research and endorsed by the National Heritage Board and National Parks Board.
•	EDUCATIONAL: Watch scenes from history textbooks come to life at the very location history was imprinted.
•	INTERACTIVE: Using the latest in AR technology, the app reproduces a creative interpretation of actual historical events at each touchpoint of the heritage trail, for a thoroughly immersive experience.   
•	CLOCK YOUR DAILY STEPS: Put on your walking shoes and go on a trail back in time!
•	MOMENTO: Collect all the jigsaw pieces at each AR discovery point as a memento.

NOTES:
•	The information provided in the BALIKSG mobile application is designed to provide helpful information on the history and heritage of Singapore through a creative interpretation of past events. While extensive research has been done to depict historical events and persons of interest as accurately as possible, certain characters in the app are fictitious. Any similarity to actual persons, living or dead, is purely coincidental.
•	To fully experience the augmented reality features of the app, users are advised to use BALIKSG in the day, but avoiding the hottest hours between noon to 3pm. Please wear comfortable walking shoes, have an umbrella handy and stay hydrated!
•	For a more realistic AR experience, use this app on iPhone SE, 6S, 6S Plus, 7, 7Plus and newer models, iPad (5th and 6th Generation), iPad Pro (1st Generation) and newer models, on iOS 11.0 or later.
•	For a basic AR experience, use this app on iPhone 6 and newer models running iOS 10 or later. 
•	Use BALIKSG while connected to a network to improve the accuracy of GPS. You can still use the app offline, but location information will be less accurate, and some functions may not be available.
•	Users should enable location information on their devices in order to facilitate accurate way-finding. 
•	Data charges may apply.

data.description:
Welcome to The Asian Civilisation Museum’s mobile experience. We developed this app to give visitors like you, an in depth look at the mysterious and wondrous art and culture collection at ACM. Bring your experience to life by engaging with informative audio, beautiful video and descriptive text about the museum and its collection, as well as free self-guided audio tours, and interactive exhibition maps to help you find your way.

Take your first step into the amazing ACM journey by experiencing our collection highlights tour - a must for visitors short on time - or take your little ones on a dedicated children’s tour, featuring content crafted specially for our most inquisitive visitors.    

“What’s On” provides information on upcoming museum-led events and programmes, guided tours, lectures, and festivals. “What to See” details the museum’s permanent galleries and special exhibitions, and offers object-level interpretation beyond traditional labels and wall texts.

Be sure to download the Asian Civilisations Museum app before your next visit for a sneak preview of the journey that awaits you.

data.description: The Singapore Satellite Positioning Reference Network (SiReNT) is a national reference network infrastructure, developed to support real-time high precision Positioning, Navigation and Tracking (PNT). An initiative by Singapore Land Authority (SLA), SiReNT supports GNSS (Global Navigation Satellite System) systems such as NAVSTAR GPS, GLONASS, QZSS, Beidou and Galileo. It provides Differential GNSS (DGNSS, also known as DGPS) services which improve the accuracy and reliability of PNT.

data.description: Busy missy is a single user self-learning nursing skills centric game which aims to help nursing students learn the nursing skills in a fun, interactive and engaging manner. The game also aims to make learning more meaningful by integrated knowledge and practice within clinical scenarios. Within the game, a scenario or patient background will be presented to the player. The player has to ask or answer the right questions and perform the right task as he/she progress through the storyboard. The game illustrates the admission, hospitalization and discharge of a patient.  During admission & hospitalization, there are activities to assess the students’ assessment, diagnosing, planning, implementation, evaluation and documentation skills.

data.description:
This app is an educational tool that acts as both a reference and a self-assessment tool for skeletal bones and joint movements.

The app consists of 5 different bone sets:
• cranial bones 
• upper limb
• lower limb
• facial
• axial skeleton

Users can:
• browse the reference section to learn about the bone groups
• try assembling each bone group from constituent bones, then name them
• test themselves on correct joint movements using the accelerometer (e.g. abduction at left shoulder)

Points are awarded for correctly joining the bones to form a bone group as well as correct movement of the joint.

This app is developed for the School of Health Sciences, Ngee Ann Polytechnic. For more information, please contact sch_hs@np.edu.sg.
data.releaseNotes: Upgraded to 3D model of the Skeleton and also to support the latest iOS and all the iPhone screen sizes.

data.description:
Virtual Hospital 2 can be played as both single-user and multi-user game. It is developed for Year 2 and Year 3 Nursing students at the School of Health Sciences, Ngee Ann Polytechnic. The game-based, learner-centered approach empowers students to build on knowledge learnt in the Nursing Science modules. In the multi-player mode, students are involved in collaborative learning as they work as a team to solve problems.
 
The game depicts real-life scenarios showing different types of patients with different clinical conditions. In the game, the students are trained in various skills, such as nursing care and management of patients. They are expected to demonstrate competence in caring for patients with various clinical conditions. Every appropriate nursing interventions lead to gaining points and progression in the game.
 
The app. is also a good tool to help the students develop clinical judgment, clinical reasoning and critical thinking skills through real-life scenarios.

data.description:
The RESUS App is developed for nursing students at the School of Health Sciences, Ngee Ann Polytechnic. It is the simple and fast way to help students to learn and test them on the correct CPR techniques and processes. Also, it is the good way to augment learning in emergency and critical care nursing.

The app comprises of the following sub-modules:
• BCLS (4 modules)
   1. One man adult CPR 
   2. Relief of adult foreign body airway obstruction (FBAO)
   3. Infant one-rescuer CPR
   4. Relief of  infant foreign body airway obstruction (FBAO)
• BCLS instructor course
• Megacode

The app allows the users to simulate cardiac compression and ventilation. It incorporate a metronome to simulate cardiac compressions for deliverance of 100 beats per minutes.

A question bank with appropriate taxonomy levels is set up for students to perform self-assessment on the theoretical contents covered in the modules.

The app depicts 4 real-life scenarios. It is a good tool to enable students practise life-saving decision-making skills while handling different case scenarios.
data.releaseNotes: Minor bug fix for devices running iOS 11.2 updates.

data.description:
Learning endocrine system is very complex and confusing as students need to remember total number of 14 endocrine structures, more than 30 hormones and their different actions on various target organs in the body. Students need more practice to be familiar with terminology, to have better retention to remember the names and actions of different endocrine glands and respective hormones etc.  Endocrine Game is specially designed to help students learn about the complex human endocrine system through play on their mobile iOS devices. Players can test their knowledge of different endocrine glands and hormones secreted in the body system. They simply choose correct endocrine organ/s or hormone secreted level by level (e.g., head level, neck level, chest level, abdomen level and gonads) from the given list of answer keys. They can do numerous attempts to improve their score. 
Enhance your learning experience… try and test yourself as you learn the endocrine system, using this innovative, interactive way on the go anytime anywhere !
data.releaseNotes: This update is signed with Apple’s latest signing certificate. No new features are included.

data.description:
The name C28 refers to the 28 days menstrual cycle. 
This mobile game is designed to enhance learning in human anatomy and physiology for the medical and health sciences students. Even for the learners without prior biological background, you can play this anatomy game easily and learn the different complex cycles of female reproductive system such as uterine cycle, ovarian cycle, changing levels of various sex hormones and better understanding of safe & unsafe periods. A highly interactive set-up, a sperm moving around to select the day to answer which engages the users effectively to enhance self-directed learning.
A comprehensive reference section, scoring and systematic feedback from the app enable the learners to achieve the desired active learning goal conveniently on the GO!. In fact, this game is your pocket learning resource or your practice companion to tackle the complexity of the female reproductive system of the human anatomy.

This mobile game is designed to enhance learning in human anatomy and physiology for the medical and health sciences students. Even for the learners without prior biological background, you can play this anatomy game easily and learn the different types of cranial nerves. A highly interactive set-up, the roulette wheel, engages the users effectively to complete the learning journey for the whole set of cranial nerves.  
Being the only 12 pairs of nerves in the body which attach directly the brain, you might wonder how these nerves are special. This game strengthens your knowledge in the following aspects. 
1)	Identifying the cranial nerves with the names & the assigned numbers. 
2)	Classification according to their nature & function such as pure motor, pure sensory, special sensory, mixed nerve etc. 
3)	Names & functions of the cranial nerves for special sensory.
4)	Names & functions of the cranial nerves for pure sensory. 
5)	Names & functions of the cranial nerves for pure motor. 
6)	Names & functions of the mixed cranial nerves.
7)	Identifying the cranial nerve which functions in autonomic nervous system. 
A comprehensive reference section and systematic feedback from the app enable the learners to achieve the desired learning goal conveniently. In fact, this game is your pocket learning resource or your practice companion to tackle the complexity of the nervous system of the human anatomy.

data.description:
Cell cycle is the series of events that happen as cells grow and divide. All organisms rely upon cell division for reproduction, repair and growth. However, the steps of the cell cycle are complicated for students and require time and practice to understand. Thus, this cell cycle game has been designed with the objective to make student understand the events taking place in the cell during cell cycle. 
This game uses a roulette wheel format to challenge students to use what they know about cell division to play a game in which they identify phases of cell division (mitosis). This game enhances students’ knowledge on cell cycle in the following ways:
-	Provides a comprehensive coverage of the cell cycle.
-	Challenges students to identify the stages of the mitosis cell cycle by matching the phases with the descriptions.
-	Aids students in recalling key concepts of the stages of the cell cycle.
This game is an excellent way to reinforce the topic on cell division and discover the events that occur in each phase of the cell cycle. So, can you identify the stages of the cell cycle?

The Master Plan is the statutory land use plan which guides Singapore's development in the medium term over the next 10 to 15 years. It shows the permissible land use and density for developments in Singapore and is reviewed every five years. The Master Plan is to be read together with the Master Plan Written Statement.

This is the Master Plan 2014. The Master Plan 2014 and Master Plan Written Statement 2014 have been approved by the Minister for National Development on 27 May 2014. The Master Plan Written Statement 2014 and all subsequent amendments to the Master Plan and the Master Plan Written Statement are available at the website of the Urban Redevelopment Authority (URA) at http://www.ura.gov.sg/

Whilst every reasonable endeavour has been made to ensure that the contents of the Master Plan 2014 is represented accurately, the URA and the Singapore Government disclaim all liability for any injury, loss or damage whatsoever that may arise as a result of any inaccuracy, error or omission.

About ACRA On The Go
ACRA On The Go is a mobile extension of key services currently available on BizFile+ - the online business filing and information portal managed by the Accounting and Corporate Regulatory Authority (ACRA). Business owners can perform a range of business registration and filing transactions with ACRA On The Go. The public can access business related information for free as well as purchase business information products.

The following services are available on the ACRA On The Go mobile app: 

∙         Business Registration and Filing services  
Business owners can renew registration for certain business entities, file annual declarations or change address for business entities. Enquiries on the status of selected applications including striking off or Extension of Time that have been filed with ACRA can also be made. 

∙         Directory Search 
Allows users to conduct a preliminary check on business entities, including basic information such as its Unique Entity Number (UEN), entity name, status, and the street name as reflected in its registered business address. 

∙         iShop@ACRA 
To facilitate the purchase of electronic products such as business profile while the customer is on the move.

∙         AGM Calculator 
Enables directors and companies to plan when to hold their next AGMs and also meet the statutory requirements under the Companies Act. 

∙         AskACRA

data.description:
Log in within seconds using your fingerprint or 6-digit passcode.

KEY FEATURES

- Say goodbye to long passwords

With the SingPass Mobile app, you don’t have to enter your SingPass ID or password. Simply scan or tap the QR code to launch the app, verify and you’re in!

- Transact securely on-the-go

Going for a holiday or staying overseas? Enjoy greater mobility when you use the new SingPass Mobile app. No more waiting for SMS OTP, or carrying a token around!

- Be secure every step of the way

We’ve got several layers of security measures in place to protect your personal data. You only need to log in with your fingerprint or enter a 6-digit passcode to verify your identity for all transactions.

- Log in like a pro with QR

Log in by scanning a QR code using your SingPass Mobile QR code scanner. If you’re using a mobile device, simply tap on the QR code to launch the app.

- Better together

We will be adding new features into the app to help you manage your data and transactions better, so keep your app updated!

SET UP IN 3 EASY STEPS

To set up, all you need is a smartphone, an internet connection, and a registered SingPass account.

- Step 1
Install SingPass Mobile by clicking the button above.

- Step 2
Complete a one-time set up.

- Step 3
You’re all set. Log in to government digital services using your fingerprint or 6-digit passcode – it’s that simple!

FEEDBACK

We want to hear from you! For feedback, questions or concerns,
please email us at support@singpass.gov.sg.

Note: SingPass Mobile can only be installed on one device at a time.

This application is bought to you by the Government Technology Agency of Singapore.


***
Directed to singpassmobile.sg when you tapped the QR code during login?

This is due to a delay by iOS at times in retrieving the required configuration file (Apple-App-Site-Association), which is necessary for QR code tapping (Universal Link) to work.

Here are some workarounds that worked well with other users experiencing this same issue:
- try again later. Most users reported that iOS managed to retrieve the necessary config after some time
- uninstall SingPass Mobile from your device, and download the app again from the official App Store
data.releaseNotes:
Thanks for using SingPass Mobile! We’re working hard to optimise our app and have made some things a lot better in this release.

- Random crash fix during registration on iOS 9 and iOS 10

- Stability enhancements and optimisations

data.description:
The JTC Survey Fee Calculator application is developed by JTC Corporation to provide users an estimate of the survey fees payable for a range of survey works required. These survey works include:

 - Lease Allocation Survey
 - Temporary Occupation License (TOL) Survey
 - Subdivision Survey
 - Amalgamation Survey

Besides calculating the total survey fee, the application will present a breakdown of the components as follows:

 - JTC Survey Fee
 - URA Processing Fee (where applicable)
 - SLA Survey Fee (where applicable)
 - Goods and Services Tax (GST)

About JTC Corporation
JTC Corporation (JTC) is Singapore’s leading industrial infrastructure specialist spearheading the planning, promotion and development of a dynamic industrial landscape.  

For more than 40 years, JTC has played a key role in the growth of the economy by providing cutting-edge industrial real estate solutions. Some of its landmark projects include wafer fabrication parks, business parks, Biopolis and Fusionopolis at one-north, a chemicals hub on Jurong Island, biomedical parks as well as logistics hubs for various industries. These industrial and business parks are now home to renowned global companies and promising local enterprises.   

Today, JTC continues to break new ground with pioneering projects that anticipate and address the future needs of industry. The Jurong Rock Caverns look to subterranean depths to optimise land use; Seletar Aerospace Park and Tukang Innovation Park support the growth of new industry clusters in aerospace and innovation activities; CleanTech Park, Singapore's first eco-business park, offers unique clean technology features and also serves as a 'living lab' for the test-bedding and development of green technologies and sustainable urban solutions; and the Jurong Island Version 2.0 initiative plans to cut carbon emissions and enhance competitiveness of the chemicals hub.

As Singapore transforms itself for the future, JTC will partner with its customers to understand their evolving needs and develop appropriate 'future-ready' infrastructure solutions. The Corporation will continue to expand its innovation capacity and offer infrastructure facilities of a calibre that sets the city state apart as an investment location. JTC will hence position itself as an industrial infrastructure innovator that creates value for its customers by developing the optimal infrastructure solutions that they aspire. This will help differentiate Singapore and propel it to the next level of growth.

For more information on JTC and its products and services, please visit www.jtc.gov.sg.

data.description:
SGWorkPass is a free mobile app to check the validity of work passes / long term passes issued by the Singapore Ministry of Manpower (MOM).
 
A must have app for all employers, foreign employees, agents or anyone who wishes to verify if a work pass / long term pass card issued by MOM is valid. You will need a Singapore mobile number for a one-time registration in order to start using the app.
 
Scan it to check it
A work pass / long term pass could be cancelled before it expires as employment / stay status can change over time. When this happens, the pass holder is not allowed to continue working / staying in Singapore. Simply launch the SGWorkPass app to scan the QR code of a work pass / long term pass card and you can verify its validity instantly.
 
No QR Code? No problem!
If the work pass / long term pass card doesn’t have a QR code, you can verify it using the unique Card Serial Number printed on the card.
data.releaseNotes: System enhancements

data.description:
Are your muscles stiff and aching after sitting for long hours at your desk? How can you improve your lifting posture?

Introducing ergo@WSH – a mobile application on ergonomics developed by the Workplace Safety and Health (WSH) Institute, Singapore for iOS smart phones and tablets.

What is it? 
ergo@WSH is meant for both WSH professionals and the general public. WSH professionals can use it as a tool to identify ergonomic hazards in the workplace and provide recommendations to prevent musculoskeletal complaints. It can also help to raise general awareness of good postures.

data.description:
Volunteers are notified via the myResponder Mobile App by SCDF’s 995 Ops Centre of any Cardiac Arrest Case within 400 metres of their location. If you are notified, you may choose to respond to the incident and offer your assistance. The Mobile App will highlight nearby AEDs that may be available. 

Once you have located the victim suffering from cardiac arrest, you can assist the original caller who alerted SCDF in performing CPR or helping to apply the AED to revive the patient. SCDF’s 995 Ops Centre may also ask responders to guide the ambulance crew by escorting them to the incident site.

If you are 15 years and above and wish to volunteer, be sure to get your SingPass ID and password ready. If you are under 18 years old, please seek parental consent for your participation. Your handphone number is also required for SCDF to get in touch with you during an emergency. 

Your response is entirely voluntary, and we only encourage you to respond when you are available and to do so within safe and reasonable means.

myResponder is the latest project by the Singapore Civil Defence Force. The myResponder Mobile App alerts volunteers to nearby Cardiac Arrest Cases to render first aid before ambulance arrival. With myResponder, volunteers will have the following services at their fingertips:

- Geolocation notification of nearby cases
- Display of nearby incidents using OneMap
- Display of nearby AEDs using OneMap
- Geolocation enabled dialling of 995
- Access to the National AED Registry

Please note that continued use of GPS running in the background can dramatically decrease battery life.

The Singapore Civil Defence Force – The Lifesaving Force

data.description:
MindWorks is a set of brain training games designed for older adults. These games were developed by researchers from the Centre for Applied Gerontology and students from Temasek Polytechnic (Singapore), in collaboration with renowned neuroscientist Professor Ryuta Kawashima from Tohoku University (Japan). 

There are 6 games which involve memory, attention, logic and arithmetic calculation. Through our research and testing, the results have shown that these games could activate the brain’s prefrontal areas of older adults during gameplay. The prefrontal cortex (PFC) of the brain is responsible for executive functions such as decision-making and problem-solving. Studies have shown that activation of the PFC could potentially improve cognitive performance and function. 

Upon completion of each game, the player will be provided feedback on his/her performance through the comparison with other players’ scores in the same age group. On-going research will be conducted to validate the cognitive effects of these games in improving cognitive abilities for daily life activities in older adults.

data.description:
Singapore has built a robust water supply system through the Four National Taps (water from local catchment areas, imported water, reclaimed water known as NEWater and desalinated water). Today, more than 5 million people enjoy clean, safe water at a turn of tap. To ensure water sustainability for Singapore increasing water supply alone is not sufficient; managing the demand for water is just as crucial. We must all treat water as a precious resource and make every drop count.

In line with PUB’s initiative to make water conservation a way of life, the game hopes to encourage adoption of water saving habits. This game starts with a simple one-touch mechanism that enables user to save water in different ways. The first installation of game spreads across 30 levels and 6 backdrops. As the user moves to the other levels, more game mechanisms and game items are included to enhance it. 

For more info on water conservation, please log on to www.pub.gov.sg/conserve

This is an interactive ECG teaching app designed by cardiologists to help teach the clinical pearls of ECG interpretation to doctors, healthcare professionals and students.

This app includes many case-based examples, quizzes and tips and tricks that will help in the learning process.

This app has been endorsed by several major cardiology societies.

Heart failure is one of the leading causes of recurrent hospitalization, reduced life expectancy and diminished quality of life in the world. • Dashboard that provide you with an overview of your fitness, Healthpoints and rewards information. 
• Health Challenges that enable you to step up to get healthy, earn Healthpoints and redeem rewards
• New Eat Drink Shop Healthy Challenge digital passport with more rewards that can be earned along with Healthpoints when you make healthier purchases

• Healthpoints history function that allows tracking of your scans from healthier food, drink or grocery consumption
• Nearby listing and map views on HPB events, healthier eateries, exercise facilities and routes in your vicinity
• Integration with new HPB steps trackers and exercise apps including Actxa®, Fitbit® and Apple Health (together with Apple Watch and other devices that provides data into Apple Health as the device source) and in-device motion tracker
• Sync for Friends function to allow both non-smartphone and smartphone participants to conveniently sync their steps on their friend or family member’s smartphone
• Background location detection of nearby Scan&Win Hotspots for earning Healthpoints


Note:
• This app uses background location for detection of outdoor Hotspots
• Continued use of GPS running in the background may dramatically decrease battery life
• For the optimum experience, please ensure that your phone is set to Singapore Time zone (GMT +8)
• For any enquiries, please call our hotline at 1800 567 2020 or email us at stepschallenge@hpb.gov.sg

data.description: The hiSG mobile application is brought to you by the Health Promotion Board (HPB), exclusively for participants of the Health Insights Singapore (hiSG) study. The hiSG mobile app is designed to provide hiSG participants with a more seamless and engaging study experience by allowing them to respond directly to study questionnaires on the app and log their meals taken via the app’s meal logging tool. Participants are also able to track their progress in the study, earn Healthpoints for participation in study activities, as well as gain deeper insights on their health via the app.
data.releaseNotes:
- Added a new Progress tab where you can now conveniently track your study participation with a progress overview report and a calendar view of each study requirement.
- Improvement to meal logging flow. The meal logging tab has been removed; you can now log meals directly from the dashboard by tapping on specific meals.

data.description:
Are busy schedules and endless social commitments making it hard to stick to your health goals? Bitesize makes it easier by helping you find little opportunities in your lifestyle to stay active every day.

Bitesize supports and guides you with simple achievable exercises to help you progress in your routine and complete harder exercises over time. By getting to know you better, it can personalise your Dailys and recommend the right workouts that are fit for you. You can even customise Bitesize based on your preferences!

Bitesize is an initiative by Health Promotion Board Singapore.

Features:
Dailys: Gain access to simple and customisable exercises in Cardio, Flexibility and Strength
Challenges: Unlock more difficult Dailys by completing challenges
Feedback: Get exercise recommendations based on how you perform
Weekly Report: Discover insights to reflect on your weekly activity
Notifications: Receive encouragement and reminders to exercise throughout the day

This app helps you find DMEs and make an appointment for a medical examination.

Any person who wishes to apply for CAAS pilot or air traffic controller licence is required to have a valid Medical Assessment of the relevant class. This application provides the updated list of Designated Medical Examiners (DMEs) who are able to perform the relevant Licensing Medical Examination and Aeromedical Review for applicants or licence holders.  Information provided by this application includes clinic location, onsite investigation facilities, contact number and contact email of each of the DMEs.
data.releaseNotes: Fixes a bug that is preventing the display of updated list of DMEs.

data.description:
HelpBuddy is a mobile app jointly developed by the Singapore Management University (SMU) and the Municipal Services Office (MSO) that aims to encourage residents to take ownership of their living environment, facilitate volunteerism and community participation. 

The app would recommend activities to users based on user’s preferences, task history and physical proximity to activity’s location. The data collated would help to support behavioural research and allow SMU researchers and Government agencies to understand the users’ attitudes and behaviours towards this new concept.
data.releaseNotes: • Email verification update in registration screen.

data.description:
MSS’ Weather@SG provides the latest warnings, forecasts and observations at your fingertips. Through this app, users can:
•	Receive warnings of heavy rain and other hazards
•	Access weather forecasts
•	View real-time weather observations 

------------------------------------------------------------------------


For a full suite of weather information, please visit http://www.weather.gov.sg or follow MetServiceSG on Twitter to receive more updates.

The Meteorological Service Singapore (MSS) is Singapore’s national authority on the weather and climate. It is an operations division under the National Environment Agency (NEA).
Our mission is to observe and understand the weather and climate affecting Singapore and to provide services in support of national needs and international co-operation. The key areas within the mission include:
•	Collecting and maintaining of reliable long-term national weather records
•	Providing reliable weather and climate services
•	Conducting high quality research to advance understanding and prediction of the weather and climate of Singapore and the region
•	Performing risk and impact assessment of natural environmental hazards

This application is a service of the Singapore government.

data.description:
NYP Mobile is the official mobile app designed for Nanyang Poly’s students and staff.  Designed to enhance the experience of our community, it offers access to commonly used E-Services directly from the phone or tablet. Navigate NYP on the go and see the rich campus life through info and events. Users will also be able to view all full-time and part-time courses offered by the polytechnic.

NYP Mobile allows you to:
- See how crowded canteens and library study spaces are
- Check how crowded the i@Central help desk is
- Get a campus map, learn how to get to NYP,  and find out about bus arrival timings at nearby bus stops
- Find contact information in the staff directory
- Receive Info Alerts 
- Check out the facilities and food outlets available
- Students can check timetable and exam results
- Staff can apply for annual leave

data.description:
The Singapore Institute of Retail Studies (SIRS) is a CET Institute of Nanyang Polytechnic. It was set up in January 2006 collaboratively between Singapore Workforce Development Agency (WDA) and Nanyang Polytechnic (NYP) to upgrade the skills profile and to raise the professionalism of the retail workforce in Singapore. As the National CET Institute (NCI), a pinnacle status for CET centres, SIRS provides training for Retail and Service courses under the Workforce Skills Qualifications (WSQ) Framework in a modular or full qualification basis. SIRS also operates a Career Service Centre to assist job seekers who are unemployed or employed in the non-retail industry seeking to acquire new skills through attending SIRS Retail WSQ programmes and switch careers into the retail industry.

About the Application

>> Course Information
Understand training programmes and courses offered by SIRS, course overview, calendar. Interested individuals can sign up for the classes available. 

>> Career Services
Individuals can obtain information on job opportunities and seek employment assistance and guidance.

>> Contact Us
Check out the location of SIRS via address or location map. Contact SIRS via phone or email or enquires.

data.description:
Central Quest is an interactive game which taps on iBeacon and Augmented Reality technology. Explore ITE College Central on a time-travelling adventure and complete the various challenges from different time and space! 


Features:

School of Design & Media
You are in the Land of Forgotten. Capture flying dinosaurs to lift your spaceship from the swamp.

School of Electronics & Info-Comm Technology
You are teleported into a new millennium where you face an alien attack. 

School of Business & Services
You are running out of fuel for your journey home. Collect coins to accumulate the amount required to purchase the fuel.

School of Engineering
Your spaceship is damaged during an attack and you need to get supplies from the helicopter before the pirate jet planes destroy them.

data.description:
Download this free mobile app and start exploring sports and activity venues located throughout Singapore. Designed for smartphone users to make searches, reservations, registrations, purchases and quick payments, all in one convenient, feature-rich app. Real-time access to all facilities and programmes made available to the public by Sport Singapore. 


Key features:


Steps tracker
Now the apps integrates with Apple HealthKit to keep track of the steps you have conquered for each challenge/campaign organized.


All user types
Registered users. Verified members. Supplementary (family) accounts. Junior (under-16) members.  All can use ActiveSG with varying privileges. 


Smart search 
Search for a sports facility nearby, view its location and check its amenities. Ask the app to recommend best possible venues for your interests..


End-to-end booking
Venue, date and time selection. Course registrations. Event sign-ups. Shopping cart with options for add-on items. Payments, cancellations and refunds.
 

One-touch booking
The app remembers all your previous bookings so you can grab your favourite slots the next time round. No need to retrace your steps.


Virtual ID
Check in and check out of a swim or gym facility, by scanning the QR code on your mobile phone screen (after buying an entry pass).
